Installing solar panels can be a smart investment - both financially and environmentally.\n How profitable it is depends on where you live, how much sunlight you get, and the electricity prices in your area. This app helps you assess whether switching to solar energy is worth it, based on weather data, electricity prices, and your location. Here, we explain the most important things you should know before making a decision.

Electricity prices in Norway vary depending on region, time of year, and overall energy demand. These prices can significantly affect how quickly your investment in solar panels pays off. By comparing current and historical electricity prices, this app helps you evaluate how much money you could save by producing your own electricity with solar panels. Prices are usually measured in øre/kWh, and vary across different price zones in the country.

Solar panels have become a popular option for many people who want to produce their own electricity, save money and contribute to more sustainable energy consumption. But as with all investments, there are both advantages and disadvantages that you should be aware of.\n
Environmentally friendly: Solar panels produce clean, renewable energy and help reduce greenhouse gas emissions.\n
Reduced electricity bills: You can save money over time by producing your own electricity.\n
Support schemes: In Norway, there are public support schemes that can cover part of the installation cost.\n
Low maintenance: Once the system is installed, it requires little maintenance.\n
Increased home value: A solar system can make the home more attractive when reselling.\n
High initial costs: The investment in solar panels is still relatively high.\n
Low production in winter: Dark winters and snow can significantly reduce efficiency.\n
Location-dependent: How much electricity you produce depends on your location and sun exposure.\n
Long payback period: It can take many years before the investment is repaid.\n
Technical limitations: Not all buildings are equally suitable for the installation of panels.\n

The app estimates how much money you could save by installing solar panels, based on your local weather and past electricity prices. By comparing how much power you can produce with how much electricity costs today, you get an idea of your yearly savings. More sun and higher prices mean more savings. This helps you decide whether investing in solar panels is the right choice for you.

For cabins that are off-grif, solar panels can be an efficient and sustainable solution to cover basic electricity needs. Depending on the cabin\'s location and how much sunlight it gets, solar power can be enough for things like lighting, charging phones and tablets, running a cooler, or powering small water pumps. This app helps you easily estimate how much solar energy your cabin can produce and what kind of equipment it could support.

Solar panels come in various types, each with distinct advantages and characteristics. Monocrystalline panels offer high efficiency and longevity, making them ideal for limited roof spaces. Polycrystalline panels are more affordable and suitable for larger installations. Thin-film panels are flexible and lightweight, making them suitable for specialized applications like curved surfaces. The choice of panel type depends on factors such as budget, available space, and desired efficiency. You may be eligible for financial support from Enova, a Norwegian government agency that funds energy-efficient solutions like solar panels. As a homeowner, you can receive up to NOK 32,500 in support depending on your system\'s size and efficiency.
